intro: Ionoxalis metcalfei, commonly known as the Cape iron cross, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the genus Ionoxalis in the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking purple flowers with a distinctive cross-shaped pattern on the petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ionoxalis metcalfei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in temperate climates.
